ratings.comment: Yup, he's the best. It's as simple as that. He's always dealing with the issue. Whatever old text we read he makes it seem really important and is able to make me see it and understand it.

I can't tell you how great having a professor like Hayder is. I always imagined I might find smart and interesting people at University. Well, I found Hayder just before I graduated. I feel very lucky to have had him.
The highlight of my week were this professor's classes. Even when I was tired and wanted to be at home these classes breathed new life into me.
Very cool professor. He knows his stuff and is funny. I didn't have a class I didn't learn something from.
He saved anthropology for me. I was thinking of majoring in another degree. His classes were so much. I am grateful to Prof Almohammad. Hes the best.
Al-Mohammad is the best professor that I've had. Went in not knowing what anthropology of religion was at all and he made it easy to understand. Group project was a lot of fun.

The course was great. Hayder was very serious and made the class fun. You couldn't be bored in class. He  helped me see how important arguments are and why I needed to argue for things in papers. I learnt a lot.

He has trouble relating to and explaining things to his students and is demeaning when someone asks a question. He once gave me a confusing answer due to a tangent that he was pursuing. When I asked the same question a few lectures later, he gave me the opposite answer, as I'd originally expected. Don't confuse his pretentiousness with intellect.

Hayder is a funny guy but with serious intellectual demand. He challenges you about all the things you know or you thought you knew. Very helpful in office hours one on one. Office hours Recommended! Not many exams. He expects very high level thinking and writing from you. It was a hard semester but worth having him as an excellent instructor!

Professor Al-Mohammad is a very impressive lecturer. He is very smart and doesn't have a problem with dealing with tough ideas. If you want to think he's the professor for you.  He scared the students who were hoping to get an easy A. I thought his lecturers were brilliant.

Despite what some comments say, Prof Al-Mohammad is a very nice guy. If you have any concerns, visit him in office hours! Although the readings he assigns are extremely dense, he does his best to clarify the main points during lecture. He always has interesting stories and has a great sense of humor. 2 exams at 30% each, so don't screw up!

Professor Al-Mohammad is a strange mixture of intense and funny. He really takes what he teaches seriously. He was angry at the students for the cheating that took place on the online exam.  This didn't make the cheaters happy.  I am a bio-chemist and had to take this course. By the end of the semester I wished I was an anthropology major.
A great course. Clear and well structured. He dealt with the mass cheating very well.   He's the best lecturer I've had by far.

It was his first semester teaching and it didn't go well. He made the class much harder than it had to be for the first half of it. His lectures had nothing to do with the readings, and seemed to not be worth it at all. Tests were almost word for word out of the book. He's a funny guy though and nice, i would expect the class to get better next yr.
He is my favorite professor. His lectures are about things I haven't thought about. He is very passionate. I will be taking more courses with him.

Avoid this professor. The communication between himself, the TA's, and the students is terrible. The course material is interesting, but his exams were about picky details that were irrelevant to the course. His lectures got more unclear as the semester progressed. He is funny, but he doesn't play around. I was disappointed in him and the course.

The worst professor I have had at the University of Wisconsin thus far.  His lectures are completely disorganized and hardly pertain to his exams.  The exams were poorly written and the point distribution was very messed up.  When I went to his office hours for help, he was very rude to me.  I would recommend avoiding this professor at all costs.

He's functioning at a higher level. He can talk about a conversation he had with a stranger and use it to explain very difficult ideas. I'm in awe. I've never seen anyone like him. Serious and angry about politics which got me to question my society. He's also hilarious and very sweet. He's a different type of lecturer. Young yet knows so much.

Students are angry because he caught a lot of people cheating. The disorganization of this course was the fault of the cheaters. The prof explained he couldn't trust us to do an exam online again so it was a few weeks before things became clear. He has no interest in being a crowd pleaser. He is very passionate and it rubbed off on me.

Seems like a cool enough guy outside of the classroom but he did not do a good job with this class. Extremely disorganized, never knows how to work his technology, and always seems pissed off. The best three lectures of the year were when other professors from the Anthro department stepped in for him. DO NOT take this class with him.

The Dude. He's the best professor I have ever had. He's a bit old school in wanting you to think. I can see sometimes how hard he is working and thinking when he lectures. One on one he gives a lot. A great professor who was born for this.

As a previous reviewer has already said this Professor does not aim to please the crowd. That is for sure.  For the first time in 3 years being at Madidon i felt like i was actually at a university. Professor Al-Mohammad wants his students to think. That is the what he is interested in. Hes crazy smart and deals with big ideas. I loved it.
Hayder is funny and makes lecture interesting, however, the exam was very tough. He expects us to know how to analyze long and hard passages that we have barely discussed.

He is the best. Very smart and helps you grasp difficult ideas. The professor aims high so some students can't keep. If you listen to lectures you hear how easily explains things. Wish I could've taken more courses with him.

Definitely not in lecture to please the crowd. Didn't find out until less than a month before when the exam was. Holds heavy grudges, and the online exam was extremely confusing. Assumes you know what is important, even though he claims he discusses them every lecture. Would reccommend a different professor for anthro if you need to take it

So disorganized, nothing he says makes sense. Always says "What was I talking about", trying to be funny (it's not, stop). He honestly seems like a decent guy, I've never interacted with him one on one. But he's just an awful lecturer, and is very unclear about a lot of things. Would not recommend this class if taught by him.

Professor Al-Mohammad is a great professor, despite his Yik Yak reputation. He makes a lot of jokes (some of which are funny) and is genuinely interested in the topic. He goes out of his way to expand on topics and relate them to our lives.  Disclaimer: This guy gets seriously pissed if you screw around (read: cheat on easy online exams).

Smart and helpful if you approach him. Everything he said was interesting which is pretty good. He doesn't give you the answers, he expects students to think for themselves, not sure everyone wants that.
He's funny, but kind of disrespectful. Very disorganized and unclear about many things. Teaches different material in different lectures
THe dude is cool. I got no interest in anthropology. Every lecture makes me think and ask questions about the world. He'll lecture on difficult things and somehow it makes sense.

Smart. Funny. Doesn't teach as if we're still in school. He's got a temper if you mess around. Doesnt look to please the crowd either. He teaches great. His lectures keep you awake and focused even when you're tired or worse.

This is the best class I took throughout my time at madison. If you're interested in thinking this is the professor for you. He can be unconventional. He's also very sincere and cares about his students. Maybe he's not for everyone, his classes are intense but that's how much he cares about what he's teaching.
This professor is awesome. He's funny, some of his lectures are amazing, and his english accent is cool.  Sometimes it feels like he's making jokes about us. Maybe I don't get his Britsh humour.

His lectures are very dry and hard to follow for the most part. We had an online midterm which was the only time I used my textbook. The readings are long and are summed up in class so they aren't necessarily mandatory to read. I would definitely not ever take this class with him.
Just don't take it
